subject: Decisions and Verdicts
Basketball
lead_paragraph: The former Miami Heat swingman James Posey has agreed to plead guilty to reckless driving in connection with an incident in April in Miami Beach, prosecutors said yesterday. As part of his plea agreement, he must perform 50 hours of community service, complete six months of probation, and pay court costs and a $250 fine. Posey was arrested for drunken driving April 9 after the Miami Beach police pulled him over for stopping in the middle of a road. The police said that he was unsteady on his feet, that he had slurred speech and that his breath smelled of alcohol. Posey refused to take a breath test.Posey, a free agent, has played two seasons with Miami, and the Heat is among the teams pursuing him.
